title: The History of Western Philosophy by Bertrand Russell (1945)
description:
Title: The History of Western Philosophy
Author: Bertrand Russell 
Category: Academic
Publisher: Simon & Schuster/Touchstone (1945)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 0671201581
ISBN-13: 978-0671201586

For my good friend  Anette14 , and avid admirer of Bertrand Russell and his work, and a scholar herself. Best wishes to her for success in all facets of life, always. :-)

Promotional info/Publisher's summary - "Hailed as Ã¢â‚¬Å“lucid and magisterialÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ by The Observer, this book is universally acclaimed as the outstanding one-volume work on the subject of Western philosophy.

Considered to be one of the most important philosophical works of all time, the History of Western Philosophy is a dazzlingly unique exploration of the ideologies of significant philosophers throughout the agesÃ¢â‚¬â€from Plato and Aristotle through to Spinoza, Kant and the twentieth century. Written by a man who changed the history of philosophy himself, this is an account that has never been rivaled since its first publication over sixty years ago.

Since its first publication in 1945, Lord RussellÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s A History of Western Philosophy is still unparalleled in its comprehensiveness, its clarity, its erudition, its grace, and its wit. In seventy-six chapters he traces philosophy from the rise of Greek civilization to the emergence of logical analysis in the twentieth century. 

Among the philosophers considered are: Pythagoras, Heraclitus, Parmenides, Empedocles, Anaxagoras, the Atomists, Protagoras, Socrates, Plato, Aristotle, the Cynics, the Sceptics, the Epicureans, the Stoics, Plotinus, Ambrose, Jerome, Augustine, Benedict, Gregory the Great, John the Scot, Aquinas, Duns Scotus, William of Occam, Machiavelli, Erasmus, More, Bacon, Hobbes, Descartes, Spinoza, Leibniz, Locke, Berkeley, Hume, Rousseau, Kant, Hegel, Schopenhauer, Nietzsche, the Utilitarians, Marx, Bergson, James, Dewey, and lastly the philosophers with whom Lord Russell himself is most closely associatedÃ¢â‚¬â€Cantor, Frege, and Whitehead, coauthor with Russell of the monumental Principia Mathematica."

This is one of the great, engaging works of philosophy from the mid-20th century. A clear and thorough history of the subject by a great master himself.

For more information on this work and its considerable impact, please see the wikilink here.

"A precious book ... a work that is in the highest degree pedagogical which stands above the conflicts of parties and opinions." Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Albert Einstein

The torrent folder contains the original retail quality PDF as well as conversions into MOBI, LIT, AZW3 and EPUB formats done in Calibre. The front cover image and generated metadata.opf are also included. The EPUB copy especially came out quite well. Please seed, and enjoy.

About The Author:
Bertrand Russell (1872 - 1970). Philosopher, mathematician, educational and sexual reformer, pacifist, prolific letter writer, author and columnist, Bertrand Russell was one of the most influential and widely known intellectual figures of the twentieth century. In 1950 he was awarded the Noble Prize for Literature in 1950 for his extensive contributions to world literature and for his "rationality and humanity, as a fearless champion of free speech and free thought in the West."
